intro: Satureja elegans, commonly known as slender savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring small, lance-shaped leaves with a fragrant, minty aroma. Its flowers are pink to purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Satureja elegans is often found in rocky or dry soils and is valued for its ornamental and culinary uses.
